title: Jeremy Swayman shares humorous response to regrettable goal in first Olympic start
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed a goal from center ice during Team USA's win over Denmark in Olympic hockey.
Speculation suggested black boards interfered with puck visibility, but Swayman humorously cited his colorblindness.
Despite Swayman's performance, the U.S. secured victory with strong offense and may rely on other goalies moving forward.

title: NBA stars and legends weigh in on Jayson Tatum’s potential return this season
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Jayson Tatum may return soon from his Achilles injury, impacting the Boston Celtics' playoff run.
Kevin Durant and Carmelo Anthony believe Tatum's return would significantly strengthen the Celtics' postseason performance.
Tatum has been practicing with Celtics' G League affiliate, indicating progress in his injury recovery.

title: 5 free agents that might make the most sense for Patriots to pursue at positions of need
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots have approximately $41 million in cap space to pursue offseason free agents.
Top targeted free agents include Colts WR Alec Pierce and Packers OT Rasheed Walker for key roster improvements.
Ravens TE Isaiah Likely and Eagles EDGE Jaelan Phillips are potential valuable additions for the Patriots.

title: Making some sense of the new ESPN/MLB.TV streaming partnership and what it means to fans
author: Chad Finn
bullets: ESPN and MLB.TV have partnered, making ESPN the new streaming home for MLB games.
Subscribers can add MLB.TV to ESPN Unlimited for $134.99 per season or purchase separately for $149.99.
Some providers like Fubo and DirecTV offer ESPN Unlimited, facilitating MLB.TV sign-up and streaming.

title: ‘We’re real excited’: Celtics’ Ron Harper Jr. shares Jayson Tatum looked like himself in recent G League practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a practice with the Maine Celtics after recovering from an Achilles tear.
Celtics guard Ron Harper Jr. expressed excitement over Tatum's performance, suggesting a potential season return.
Celtics maintain no timetable for Tatum's return, despite practice and participation in team scrimmages.

title: Here’s where Mass. finished on the latest list of most educated states
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Massachusetts ranked as the most educated state in the U.S. in WalletHub's 2026 analysis.
Over 47% of Massachusetts adults hold a bachelor's degree; nearly 22% have graduate or professional degrees.
Vermont and Maryland followed Massachusetts in the rankings; Louisiana, Mississippi, and West Virginia ranked lowest.

title: One of the rarest baseball cards is up for auction â€” and there are local connections
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: A rare T206 Honus Wagner baseball card is up for auction, currently bid at $3.9 million, closing February 21.
The card was pulled from a pack by Morton Bernstein in the early 1900s and has Massachusetts connections through Taunton.
Ken Goldin, featured on Netflix's 'King of Collectibles,' highlights the card's uniqueness and historical value in the auction world.

title: Bruins G Jeremy Swayman set to make Olympic debut and start for Team USA vs. Denmark
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Boston Bruins goalie Jeremy Swayman will start for Team USA against Denmark in the 2026 Winter Olympics on Saturday.
Swayman has been a regular on Team USA's roster, aiding in their IIHF World Championship win last year.
Swayman's current season record is 22-12-3 with a 2.92 GAA and .903 save percentage.

title: New England Aquarium IDs right whale found dead off Virginia
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: New England Aquarium identified a dead right whale off Virginia as a 3-year-old female, calf of whale #3293 'Porcia'.
This marks the second right whale death in two weeks, contributing to the ongoing North Atlantic Right Whale Unusual Mortality Event.
Scientists note the critical loss due to declining population; only roughly 380 North Atlantic right whales remain, including 72 reproductive females.

title: Another child has died of the flu in Mass.
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Seven children have died from flu-related causes in Massachusetts this season, with total deaths reaching 260.
Massachusetts hospitals and pediatric units were strained due to a surge in flu cases in January.
Health officials urge vaccination as flu activity continues, affecting children, older adults, and those with health conditions.
